operations.notes: The first call authenticates an existing Point.io user to use an existing Point.io app. Use the value of SESSIONKEY value to perform all following API calls.

parameters.name: email
parameters.description: Valid Point.io account username (email address).

parameters.name: password
parameters.description: Point.io account password.

parameters.name: apikey
parameters.description: App ID of your Point.io application. See point.io/account for info.

operations.summary: Get the list of your access rules.
operations.notes: The second call lists access rules defined against the existing storage sites associated to the authorized user account. There is a one to many relationship between storage sites and access rules.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: SESSIONKEY value provided by the /auth.json method.

operations.summary: Get the list of folders and files of a specific path from a specific access rule.
operations.notes: The third call lists folders and files from the chosen access rule at the specified path.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: SESSIONKEY value provided by the /auth.json method.

parameters.name: folderId
parameters.description: Id of the access rule you want to browse. Use a SHAREID from /accessrules/list.json to identify the access rule.

parameters.name: containerid
parameters.description: Id of the folder you want to browse. If not filled, the default selected folder will be the root directory of the access rule.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: Requested folder path for file listing. Use / for workspace root directory (default).

operations.summary: Create a secure link for a file.
operations.notes: The fourth call generates a secure link for a file. The URL can be pasted into a browser to display a document viewer page.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: SESSIONKEY value provided by the /auth.json method.

parameters.name: shareid
parameters.description: Id of the access rule containing the file. Use a SHAREID from a /folders/list.json call to identify the access rule.

parameters.name: fileid
parameters.description: Id of the file to create a link to. Use FILEID value provided from a /folders/list.json call.

parameters.name: filename
parameters.description: Name of the file to create a link to. Use FILENAME value provided from a /folders/list.json call.

parameters.name: remotepath
parameters.description: Path of the folder containing the file. Use PATH value provided from a /folders/list.json call. Use / for access rule's root directory (default).

parameters.name: containerid
parameters.description: Id of the folder containing the file. Use a CONTAINERID provided from a /folders/list.json call. If not filled, the default selected folder will be the root directory of the access rule.

parameters.name: allowPrint
parameters.description: Use 1 or 0. Defines whether the viewer can print a copy of the original source file. Only available for certain file types. Default: 0

parameters.name: allowDownloadAsPDF
parameters.description: Use 1 (true) or 0 (false). Defines whether the viewer can download a PDF version of the original source file. Only available for certain file types. Default: 0

parameters.name: allowDownload
parameters.description: Use 1 (true) or 0 (false). Defines whether the viewer can download a copy of the original source file. Default: 0

parameters.name: expirationDate
parameters.description: Empty string, or a date formatted as a string in the form mm/dd/yyyy.

parameters.name: password
parameters.description: Empty string, or a plain text password challenge for the link. Default: empty String

parameters.name: restrictByIP
parameters.description: Use 1 (true) or 0 (false). Defines whether to enable link locking by IP address. Default: 0

parameters.name: maskDisplay
parameters.description: Use 1 or 0. Defines whether a viewport for deterring screen capture will be overlayed when link is viewed. Default: 0

parameters.name: comments
parameters.description: Internal comments related to this link. Default: empty String
